I would highly recommend "The Queen" as an engaging and entertaining comedy. The film stars a talented cast, including Corbin Bernsen, Joanne Whalley, Tom Berenger, Theodore Bikel, Bob Hoskins, Nicholas Lea, Gerard Butler, Callum Rennie, among others.
The film is based on the true story of Princess Diana's marriage to Prince Charles and their subsequent divorce. The film explores themes such as love, marriage, divorce, and the impact these events have on individuals and society as a whole.
Overall, "The Queen" is an engaging and entertaining comedy that is sure to please fans of the genre. So, if you're in the mood for a humorous movie, then be sure to check out "The Queen"!

Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "Red Cliff". This historical epic directed by Zhang Yiming features an ensemble cast including Takeshi Kaneshiro, Tatsuya Kimura, Kiyoshi Ichihara, Kenjiro Honda, and many more.
"Red Cliff" tells the story of the Battle of Red Cliffs, which took place between 20 February - 3 March 1643 AD during the Northern War (1576-1618 AD)). The battle was fought between two armies, one led by Nurghayz Khan and the other led by Wang Xiaozhou.
The battle was a major turning point in the Northern War. It marked the defeat of Nurghayz Khan's army, which had been leading the war against Wang Xiaozhou's army. The victory over Nurghayz Khan's army marked the end of Nurghayz Khan's reign as the Khan of the Golden Horde.
